intro: Agalmyla obiana, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant has hairy, ovate leaves and produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland and forest understory habitats. Agalmyla obiana is valued for its ornamental beauty and has traditional uses in some African cultures.
